name: Dumbell Bench Press
description: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and lie back on a flat bench with the weights at shoulder level.

name: One-arm Dumbbell Row
description: Rest one hand and one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell with the other hand, arm extended but not resting on the floor. Row the weight to your ribs.

name: Incline Dumbell Bench Press
description: Set an adjustable bench to a 45-degree incline and hold a dumbbell in each hand and lie back on a flat bench with the weights at shoulder level.

name: Chest-Supported Dumbbell Row
description: Set an adjustable bench to a 45-degree incline and lie on it facedown with a dumbbell in each hand (palms facing each other). Squeeze your shoulder blades together and row the weights to your ribs.

name: Chinup
description: Hang from a chinup bar with palms facing away from you. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pull yourself up until your chin is over the bar

name: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher
description: Hold an EZ-curl bar with a shoulder-width grip and lie back on a flat bench. Press the bar over your chest and then bend your elbows until the bar nearly touches your forehead. Extend your elbows to press the weight back up

name: EZ-Bar Bicep Curls
description: Stand up straight while holding an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle. The palms of your hands should be facing forward. While keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps. Focus on only moving your forearms and raise the weight until the bar is shoulder level.

name: Dips
description: Raise yourself on 2 supports with elbows locked. Lower your body until your shoulders are lower than your elbows. Push yourself up by straightening your arms

name: 1 mile run on treadmill
description: Use eliptical if there is joint pain

name: Dumbbell Sumo Deadlift
description: Stand with feet double-shoulder-width apart and toes turned out 45 degrees. Bend your hips back, reach down, and grasp the dumbbels with hands inside your knees. Drive through your heels to extend your hips and pull the dumbbells up until youÌ¥re standing tall.

name: Dumbbell Front Lunge
description:
Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides. Step forward with your right leg around 2 feet or so from the foot being left stationary behind and lower your upper body down, while keeping the torso upright and maintaining balance. Do not allow your knee to go forward beyond your toes as you come down, as this will put undue stress on the knee joint. Make sure that you keep your front shin perpendicular to the ground.
Using mainly the heel of your foot, push up and go back to the starting position.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Stand lunge length in front of a bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Rest the top of one foot on the bench behind you. Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the floor, then drive your heel into the floor to come back up. Complete all your reps on that side and then switch legs and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Front Squat
description: Hold Dumbbells at shoulder level and stand with feet shoulder width. Bend your hips back and squat down as low as you can without losing the arch in your lower back. Drive through your heels to come up.

name: Hip Raises
description: Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. Extend your arms out to your sides and place them on the floor at a 45-degree angle. Raise your hips so your body forms a straight line from you shoulders to your knees, squeeze your glutes tightly.

name: Raised Leg Sit Up
description: Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. Extend one leg and suspend at a 45 degree angle. Slowly and gently lift your head first, followed by shoulder blades and reach to touch the toe of your suspended leg.

name: Side Bridge
description: Lie on your side with your forearm on the floor under your shoulder to prop you up, and your feet stacked. Contract your core and press your forearm against the floor to raise your hips until your body is straight from ankles to shoulders, pause when ankles, hips and shoulders are aligned.

name: Plank
description: Get into pushup position and then bend your elbows to rest your forearms on the floor. Brace your abs.
